intro: Chromolaena hypodictya, commonly known as the Hawaiian tridax, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its flowers are yellow and are arranged in dense clusters, attracting various pollinators. Chromolaena hypodictya is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in disturbed soils, making it a common weed in tropical and subtropical areas.
